one_line: Defined app-based rideshare and delivery drivers as independent contractors, not employees.
summary_short_bullets: Classifies drivers as contractors, not employees
Limits access to employee benefits and protections
Companies must provide minimum earnings guarantees
Adds some healthcare stipends and accident insurance
Overrode conflicting local labor laws

one_line: Added the right to reproductive freedom, including abortion, to California’s constitution.
summary_short_bullets: Amends CA Constitution
Protects right to abortion
Protects access to contraceptives

one_line: Proposed a tax on high incomes to fund electric vehicle incentives and wildfire prevention; rejected by voters.
summary_short_bullets: Would impose new tax on incomes over $2M
Funding earmarked for EV subsidies
Funding also for wildfire prevention
Opposed by Governor and some groups

one_line: Reduced certain drug possession and property crimes from felonies to misdemeanors.
summary_short_bullets: Reclassified many nonviolent crimes as misdemeanors
Freed up prison space and reduced costs
Directed savings toward education and treatment
Later became controversial over crime increases

one_line: Guaranteed a minimum percentage of the state budget for K–12 schools and community colleges.
summary_short_bullets: Amended CA Constitution
Ensured annual minimum funding for schools
Applies to K–12 and community colleges
Still affects education budgets today
